Posts.Content: If I remember correctly, there have been a few doing doxil.  If anyone has any tips (I am having s0me foot rash that burns) I would love to have them.  I just finished up rads to the clavicle and that tumor shrunk to nothing, but I have a new node in the neck.  This crap never ends.  So we started doxil again.  I feel like I have some thrush in the mouth and now the rash.  Its not on the bottoms of the feet, so far its just on the sides.  Any help would be appreciated.

Posts.Title: If things come in threes...
Update - Neck Pain - Museum Trip

Posts.Content:
Good morning ladies.  I was informed this week that I cannot do rads while the doxil is in my system.  So, that's three weeks of suffering.  The pain goes from my arm sometimes to my  neck.  Feels like it is the spine.   I had the MRI last month and all was clear there.  I am not sleeping good at all.  I told the doc yesterday and he gave me MSRI (morphine sulphate) 15 mg.  I took one to fall asleep.  I slept about
 an hour before the pain in the neck woke me.  I tossed and turned and finally slept until about
 2:30 when I couldnt take it and got up and took another.  Then I slept (restlessly) until about
 6:30.  It's hard to turn my neck, but tylenol helps a little.  I really don't want to take morphine all day and night.  Plus, I woke up queasy this morning.  Just thought I would let you all know that the rads wont start until the 16th of January.
Posts.Title: No rads for another 2 weeks

Posts.Content: Cathi, so sorry you are going through this again. I just finished taxol/gemzar. Had no problems with it. Good luck. Have fun on your vacation.
Posts.Title: Here we go AGAIN......Grrrrrrrrr

Posts.Content:
Everything went fine.  The MRI showed no new involvement.  I am very happy about
 that.  The pain I am having is from the tumor pulling on a muscle.  The doc. switched my chemo to doxil and gave me my first dose today.  I am so happy there was no nerve involovement.  The pain will remain until this thing shrinks.  Today it seems to be off and on.  Doc wants me on vicodin, not motrin.  How am I going on Joseph's field trip to the Museum of Natural History tomorrow on Vicodin?, lol  Thanks for all of your good thoughts and prayers, they worked.

Pity Party for Me, Wanna Come?

Posts.Content: Hi all, have been having some issues lately and had a CT scan of the neck and chest.  I am hoping to get results today.  Can you spare a good thought or two?  Thanks.  Also, the ragweed has been killing my eyes.  So much so that I havent been on the computer in weeks.  I miss reading the boards.  Will post my results.   Stay well ladies.
Posts.Title: CT Results Today

Posts.Content: Luci, hope you had a great birthday.
Posts.Title: Happy Birthday Luci !!

Posts.Content: I had punctal plugs put into my tearducts today.  Eww, gross to me.  I have sjogrens syndrome.  I don't product tears.  Have an awful time with allergies and dry eyes.  They felt that plugging up the tearducts will keep whatever little moisture I have in the eye, instead of it draining through the tearduct into the nose.  I was very nervous.  It wasnt painful, just a bit unpleasant.  They were sore at first, but now, I dont even feel them.
Posts.Title: Eye Dr. Visit Today

Posts.Content: Hi Bernadette, this is my third recurrence. All local recurrences. I started the taxol the end of May. We added Gemzar in August I think. Good luck with the Taxol. I find it fairly easy to tolerate.
Posts.Title: Eye Dr. Visit Today

Posts.Content: I am still waiting for the authorization from my ins. company.  I cant believe they are deciding whether or not to let me do the darn MRI.  They said they would have an answer by the end of business today or beginning of business tomorrow.  I am so glad that I am not in excruciating pain anymore.  It's just annoying.   I am done, for now with my pity party.  Had brownies, jello with cool whip, meatball parm. heroe's for dinner and some very nice messages from all of you friends.  thank you all for your prayers and good thoughts, they are very much appreciated.

Posts.Title: Update on Francis

Posts.Content: Hi everyone.  I just got back from treatment and onc. visit.  This past week I have noticed that the recurrence area was beginning to swell again.  We found this new recurrence the end of May.  Was put on taxol and had a great response.  After three treatments, we could no longer feel the swollen node.  I was switched to Abraxane, supposed to be better.  I did 5 treatments and found this week my neck was beginning to get puffy again.  Doc checked and immediately took me off abraxand and back to taxol.    Next week was supposed to be my week off.  Now its back to decadron, benedryl, blah, blah, blah.  No more 1 hour in and out.  Oh well, I am praying for that same great response.  If not, its onward ho to the next chemo.  Have a great weekend ladies.
Posts.Title: Onc. Visit

Posts.Content: Beth, the above answers are correct, but I am on taxol and it does seem to give me the "zizzles" after treatments. The taxol seems to hit my "weak" spots. Hope you are doing well on the taxol.

Hi Judy, After my chemo I usually get a neupogen shot. Usually within 24 hours my legs start feeling like lead, then I get the hip pain. Usually I just take tylenol as soon as I start feeling it. I found the tylenol arthritis that lasts 8 hours lets me sleep. The pain usually goes away after about
 a day.

Posts.Content: Kathy, what you are feeling is normal. If you continue to feel depressed, please ask the doc. for some help. You have been through a great deal and you may just need to release some of those old scared feelings. I also contemplated the medical field, who better to help cancer patients than one who has been there. You will be a tremendous asset to that field. I on the other hand am still a patient and am too tired for the schooling I would need, but It's always been a dream of mine. I say go for it.

Posts.Content:
Judy, I am doing weekly Taxol. Today will be my third. I have lost my hair two times already. I remember my head being sore until the hair fell out, then it was ok. If you have a sore, you might want to ask your nurses what to put on it, you have to watch out for infection. My hair is thinning, I am waiting to run my hands through it and have a handful, then I will buzz it. This time I ordered a wig online. Previously I went, tried on, etc. The wig arrived yesterday, love the style, but the color is not right. I hope I get the replacement before the buzzcut. 
Judy, hope you feel better.

Posts.Title: got CT results

Posts.Content: Randi, good luck tomorrow. You have gotten some good advice. I would make sure I ate before going (nothing too heavy). Stay away from greasy, fried stuff until you know how you tolerate your chemo. Dont wait for the nausea to kick in, just take your meds as prescribed. Drink lots of water and try to relax (easier said than done). Please let us know how you make out.
Posts.Title: First A/C This Wednesday

Posts.Content: Hi Steph. I have Verizon as my carrier. This is the best one to use in my area. We do not have too many cell towers. I had T-Mobile before and could hardly use the phone. Most times I can even use it inside my house. Good luck choosing.
Posts.Title: clutter: what cell phone co. do you use?
Vicky.........

Posts.Content: Good morning ladies.  I was supposed to start my weekly taxol today.  But, over the weekend, I developed pain up in the gum.  It seems when I had a tooth pulled years ago, the dentist left a piece of tooth.  Well, I guess it is deciding to give me a problem.  I called the onc. on Tuesday morning and they had me go to the dentist.  Have to take care of the problem before starting chemo.  So this morning its off to the surgeon to have it cut out.  I have to call the onc. office after to let them know if there is infection, stitches, etc.  So, for now, I do not know how soon I can start treatment.  As all of you know, once you know you have cancer in you, you want it taken care of.  Please think of me at 9:00 this morning.
Posts.Title: Treatment delayed

Posts.Content:
Thanks all. Got home early. Tooth was just starting to get infected. The surgeon said I was smart to start the amoxicillin on Sunday or it would have been worse. I didnt even get a stitch. I will be on Amoxicillin for 10 says. Oncologist set me up for Friday treatment and a neupogen (ouch) shot on Saturday.
Ellen, as far as I am concerned, we are still on for Sunday. Between the taxol and neupogen I may be aching but, I will make a wardrobe change and wear comfy shoes instead of the heels. Let me know what you are wearing. Talk to ya soon.

Posts.Title: laure' and vicky

Posts.Content: Good morning Tammy. I did taxotere, a form of taxol. I found it easier to tolerate than the A/C. No nausea. I got heartburn, but used pepcid. You will get pre meds (benedryl, decadron and an anti-nausea med). The infusion will take a couple of hours. The benedryl may make you sleep. All I know is that the decadron gave me energy and made me hungry. The worst side effect for me was taste bud changes. After three days, everything would taste salty. Morning coffee does not taste good salty. After a few days it would pass. I had treatment once every three weeks. Good luck, let us know how it goes. If you have any other questions, just ask.

Posts.Content: If it is the Oct. 16th weekend and Ellen is willing to take me with her, I'm in. I'm not much for driving by myself. Would love to meet everyone

Posts.Title: Today I find out if it is Cancer or B9

Posts.Content: I have lost my hair twice. Both times I went to a local salon that has a room in back for privacy. There I was able to try on wigs. I found that the ones that resembled my own hair looked horrible on me. I went for a little lighter color with highlights. This way you didnt have that flat all around color. I also ordered one from Paula Young.com. I had to order a petite (it helped going to the wig shop, there she told me I had a small head) When the wig came, it had too much hair. I brought it to my stylist and she trimmed it up and it looked great. Average price for the Paula Young wigs are $30. I got that one so that I could alternate and clean them. Good luck.

Posts.Content: I had a real bad case of reflux last weekend following treatment. By Sunday night I had to sleep sitting up to avoid the acids coming up. Dr. prescriped Protonix. I was amazing. Within a day I felt fine. Try to stay away from acidy foods and fried greasy foods. Good luck, feel better.
Posts.Title: acid reflux

Posts.Content: Ellen, I am so sorry you got that news yesterday. The same thing happened here to me when that surgeon almost killed me putting in the port. I had a two week hospital stay, chest tubes, tests, blah, blah. The attorneys offices told me since I was geting better, there was nothing they could do. Excuse me, if I spilled a cup of coffee on my lap I'd be a millionaire. Ellen, scream all you want, helps a bit. Hope you can have a better day today.
Posts.Title: fell apart today

Posts.Content: Hi Deb, I have been doing the Navelbine for over a year now and my CA 27-27 #s fluctuate between 28 and 45. They are considered stable. Any type of infection in your body may make the numbers jump. I know how you feel about the numbers going up. I get very upset when that happens.
Posts.Title: CEA and other counts up

Posts.Content: Hi Becky, so glad the rads are working. I am sorry I do not have any knowledge on that chemo. They are always coming out with new drugs, hopefully this is the one for you. Keeping you iin my prayers.
Posts.Title: hello friends!

Posts.Content: I have heard that the decadron wreaks havoc on your sugar levels. Have they said when they would try chemo? Good luck. Keep us posted
Posts.Title: What a day......

Posts.Content: Cathi, I did xeloda last year. It was the easiest chemo I have done. I also did taxatere and tolerated that well also. I didnt do them together. With the taxatere the Dr. put me on vitamin B6 100 mg to ward off that neuropathy. I didnt get much of the bone pain that many do get. After each treatment I would get a drippy nose and felt like I had a cold. Some of my nails got black streaks on them (easily covered with nail polish) The xeloda was a breeze. I did not get the diarrhea that many get. My hands and feet turned a brownish color, my kids found that weird. Feet peeled like crazy were so dry. So my advise is to get some udder cream or bag balm or a really great lotion and slather your feet nightly. Email me anytime. Good luck. Good thoughts coming your way.
Posts.Title: Chemo protocol...Xeloda questions....

Posts.Content:
Thank you all. The pain left as quickly as it came on. I cannot take any of the celebrex type drugs, I am allergic to the sulfanamides. The tylenol didnt do very much, but thank goodness I didnt need it for too long
Thanks for all your help.

Posts.Title: Here we go again......

Posts.Content: Ellen, start eating your spinach & liver. I eat beans (black beans have alot of iron). I buy all different colors, white, black, pink , rinse, chop a tomato, scallion if you like, fresh parsley and a tiny bit of garlic. Mix, toss with olive oil and whatever kind of vinegar you like, or lemon juice. It makes a nice bean salad and has a great deal of iron. If I think of more, I will write ya.

Posts.Title: probably having surgery

Posts.Content: Kathy, praying all goes smoothly for you. Don't wait for nausea to hit. I would just go ahead and take the meds for a few days. It is easier to control that way. After your second treatment, you can better judge if you will get a bit of nausea or not. Make sure you drink plenty of fluids. Don't want that stuff hanginig around your kidneys, bladder, etc. Good luck, nap away...
Posts.Title: 1st chemo today

Posts.Content: Adding prayers for Denise. RIta, thanks for keeping us informed.
Posts.Title: Prayers for Denise

Posts.Content: Kathy, good luck with your treatments. I have heard the Epirubicin is a cousin to Adriamycin. You will get plenty of pre meds for nausea and some to take afterward if you need them. For any first treatment I have, I always take the meds even if I don't feel symptoms. You do not want to wait until the symptoms appear. After your first or second treatment, you will know if you need to take anything. Also remember to drink plenty of water. You don't want that stuff sitting around in your kidneys, bladder, etc. I didn't have a problem with the taxotere besides some taste bud stuff. I had minor aches and pains, nothing to complalin about. I continued working through all the treatments. So, you will able to do your baking, lol.

Posts.Content:
Vicky, 41, New York. er/pr -, her2neu -
10/2000, lumpectomy, 2 + nodes, a/c x 4
10/2002, mastectomy, taxotere x 6
10/2003, diagnosed to left axilla nodes, xeloda Dec. - March
3/2004, left axilla dissection, 13+ nodes, doing Navelbine
Have two boys 14 and 9 and have been married for almost 20 years.
Posts.Title: ROLL CALL name, age, state and any other info to share

Posts.Content: Shells, I have this problem for years. I, until chemo, have never been regular. I am the opposite of everyone. Chemo got me regular. I find if the stoll gets too hard or I strain, I bleed. Have had colonoscopies and exams. Once it was an internal hemmorrhoid (sp). I had to take metamucil everyday to stay regular (I should be still doing this). There was a suppository the doc (gastro doc) gave me. From then, I have tried to not let myself get constipated. He told me that bright red means it is near the surface and most times not to worry about. But have it checked first. With my navelbine, I get a bit constipated the first two or so days. I try to eat dries apricots and make sure I drink plenty of water. Eat prunes, or whatever makes ya go. I know this one snuck up on you, but if you see yourself getting "behind", just increase the fluids and fruits and see if it helps.

Posts.Title: I got to see my Rads Onc today ( the one I told and he ordered tests )

Posts.Content:
Hi Jessie. Had Dr. visit, boy was my room crowded!!. My tumor markers have dropped 5 points to 40. We decided to do another cycle of Navelbine (thats 3 weeks on 1 off) because we want to get the most mileage out of this one before switching. The lesion(s) were so tiny on the ct scan they were too small to characterize. He gave me a scrip for the MRI and I will do that by Mid November. Now, I just have to find somewhere that can access my port for the injection. Seems all of the open MRI places do not.
Thanks for always thinking of me. I truly appreciate it.
